subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] those "pops" "rolling thunder" "snaps" and "boom"
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I have noticed that, especially in very active areas. I have heard a
"presence" of some sort throughout a recording made in a very EVP-active
area that goes on throughout the recording - pops, clicks, hisses, sounds
like sighing, etc. Perhaps the spirits in the area do this without knowing
it when they have enough energy available to produce EVP.
Just my guess!

Zack


On Sun, May 17, 2009 at 6:27 AM, threadsintyme@... <
Threadsintyme@...> wrote:

>
>
> You could pray for that female spirit. Sometimes just knowing that they are
> not be alone helps.
> Al
> ---------- Original Message ----------
> From: "James W. Hyslope" <clockdryve@...>

> Subject: [EVP-ITC] those "pops" "rolling thunder" "snaps"  and "boom"
> Date: Sun, 17 May 2009 06:27:07 -0000
>
>  One last question before I got to bed after 1am :) What are those noises
> often heard before or after an EVP? I have found quite a few voices that I
> wouldn't have noticed hadn't I first heard a "pop" sound. Actually had to do
> some MAJOR enhancing on 2 of them to even hear them at all. I mean one was
> impossibly buried in the noise. But after slowing it down I got a "wiff" of
> it, and through more passes of the Audacity effects I was rewarded with a
> female voice. It was sad though...she said in a mechanical pattern "can -
> you - help- me.........please - help. Still, the audio is so painfully low.
> Hearing her plea will forever effect me. Hopefully I can find someoneone
> here that can hear them as well as I. That can verify this for me :) I hear
> it...but is nice to know someone else is there with you :) I went back to
> that location little over an hour later (after found the voice) Is under 1
> mile from me. It's a real sad thing to hear and not knowing what to do.Jim H
